misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm can lead to security vulnerabilities in the system. In this case, the use of the DES algorithm is insecure because it has been broken and is no longer considered secure.
recommendation: Replace the use of the DES algorithm with a more secure algorithm such as AES.

misuse: CWE-757: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation
description: The selection of a less-secure algorithm during negotiation can lead to security vulnerabilities in the system. In this case, the use of the ECB mode of operation is insecure because it does not provide data confidentiality.
recommendation: Replace the use of ECB mode with a more secure mode of operation such as CBC mode.

misuse: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
description: The use of insufficiently random values can lead to security vulnerabilities in the system. In this case, the use of a hardcoded string as a key is insecure because it is predictable and can be easily guessed.
recommendation: Replace the hardcoded string with a randomly generated key that is at least 128 bits long.
